page.title: 15FARMING - DEER
page.content: Ptramigan of the grouse family are never seen below 3,000feet and are plentiful unlike the grouse, which are very scarce. The red deers' antlers are like rubber and bend. The blood supply is cut off and they go hard and the velvet rubs off in preparation for the rutting season in September. August.The ponies are shod by the local blacksmith from Fort William for walking on the hard tracks for 10-15 miles a day during the stalking season. The stags develop a voice, hormones, and roar around the hills challenging each other and rounding up groups of females in fluctuating numbers between 3 and 30. Many foreigners come for the sport of deer stalking and pay Â£100-Â£150 a day to shoot 1 stag but they do not get the carcase to keep.
